report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload

chapter_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Share

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: RedLine Stealer is a malware that emerged in 2020, discovered in underground forums being sold in different plans, starting from $100 per month. The malware offers many capabilities for device reconnaissance, remote control, and information stealing, including:

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Data from browsers (e.g. login, passwords, credit cards, cookies, etc.); Data from Discord and Telegram (e.g. chat logs, tokens, etc.); VPN and FTP Credentials;

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Since its discovery, attackers have used many different vectors to spread this stealer, including through fake installers and fake game hacking tools. Also, RedLine Stealer was found in compromised devices by the DEV-0537 hacking group (a.k.a. lapsus$).

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: In April 2022, Netskope Threat Labs identified a new RedLine Stealer campaign spread on YouTube, using a fake bot to buy Mystery Box NFT from Binance. The video description leads the victim to download the fake bot, which is hosted on GitHub.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: In this blog post, we will analyze this campaign, showing how its being spread and how the fake bot leads to RedLine Stealer.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: The malware is spread through YouTube videos that lure victims into downloading a fake bot to automatically buy Binance NFT Mystery Boxes. At this point, we found five videos across multiple channels that are part of the same campaign. All the URLs can be found in our GitHub repository.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Attacker spreading RedLine through YouTube video.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: The video description provides details and the download link for the fake bot, which is supposed to be presented as a Chrome extension.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Video description with the link to download the fake bot.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: The video description also contains different tags, probably to increase its visibility, including:

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: binance, nft, bot, buy, mysterybox, box, busd, autobuy, cryptobot, binance, bitcoin, crypto trading bot, cryptocurrency, binance trading bot, binance trade bot, bitcoin trading bot, btc, bot, binance bot trading, nance grid trading, bnb, binance nft, bot for binance, binance trading tutorial

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: All the videos we found are pointing to the same GitHub URL, downloading a file named BinanceNFT.bot v.1.3.zip. Once we decompress the ZIP file, we have the packed RedLine sample (BinanceNFT.bot v.1.3.exe) and a Microsoft Visual C++ Redistributable installer (VC_redist.x86.exe).

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Decompressed ZIP file downloaded from GitHub.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: The README.txt file contains the instructions that should be followed to run the fake NFT bot, including installing the Microsoft Visual C++. This is probably needed as RedLine is developed in .NET and it is also unpacked and injected into an executable from this framework.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Readme file.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: The first stage was likely compiled on April 5, 2022, and its responsible for decrypting and loading RedLine Stealer into another process.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Details of the packed RedLine Stealer sample.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: The binary details also include values that seem to be copied from another executable, using LauncherPatcher.exe as the original filename.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Further details about the first stage.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Many malware families use a trick to delay the execution of its functions, often to delay the execution inside sandboxes, which usually contain limited time of operation. As a result, there are sandboxes that are able to bypass this technique, by patching or hooking Sleep functions, for example.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: This RedLine Stealer loader contains a simple trick to evade sandboxes with such functionality. Upon execution, it tries to delay the execution by 15 seconds and compares the timestamp (GetTickCount) before and after the Sleep API execution. If the elapsed time is less than 15 seconds, it exits the process.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Trick to evade sandbox analysis.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: This can be tested by patching the Sleep function in a debugger.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: RedLine loader exiting the process if the Sleep function is bypassed.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: If the sandbox is not detected through this simple trick, it then decrypts the next stage using a simple rolling XOR algorithm with OdoAAtK as the key.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Loader decrypting RedLine Stealer payload.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Then, it executes a shellcode, which is decrypted using the same algorithm.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Loader decrypting and executing a shellcode.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: And finally, the payload is injected to RegSvcs.exe using a simple process injection technique, similar to RunPE. We also found cases where a similar loader injects RedLine Stealer into AppLaunch.exe, as we will describe later.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Loader injecting unpacked RedLine Stealer into another process.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: RedLine Stealer is developed in .NET, and the compilation timestamp was altered in the binary, showing a date from the year 2102. Formbook was also using altered timestamp dates in its payloads, which is a common behavior for malware authors to deceive analysts/researchers.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Fortunately, RedLine Stealer uses a very nonsense date, which can be used for detection in Yara rules, for example.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: RedLine Stealer payload details.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Once executed, the infostealer calls a function named Check. If this function returns true, the malware exits its process.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: RedLine Stealer Check function.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: In summary, this function verifies if the malware is running in blocklisted countries, by comparing the country name with the OS region information.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: This malware does not execute if any of these countries is detected:

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Armenia Azerbaijan Belarus Kazakhstan Kyrgyzstan Moldova Russia Tajikistan Ukraine Uzbekistan

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: We tested this by changing the OS language to Ukrainian. The malware uses the field EnglishName from the .NET RegionInfo Class to compare with the blocklist.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: RedLine Stealer exits the process if a blocklisted country is found.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: RedLine Stealer maintains a simple configuration, where the values are base64 encoded and encrypted with a rolling XOR algorithm.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: RedLine Stealer configuration.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: The decryption key used by this sample is Wombles, and we can use a simple Python script to retrieve the C2 address value:

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Decrypting RedLine Stealer C2 address.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: The ID value also uses the same algorithm:

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Decrypting RedLine Stealer ID.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: As previously mentioned, RedLine Stealer offers many capabilities to the attacker, including stealing Discord tokens.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: RedLine Stealer function that reads Discord tokens.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: Looking at the GitHub account (NFTSupp) that owns the repository where the file linked on the YouTube videos is hosted, we can see that the activities started in March, 2022.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: GitHub account and repository hosting RedLine Stealer.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: Aside from the files we analyzed in this blog post contained within BinanceNFT.bot v.1.3.zip, there are 15 additional compressed files hosted in the same repository (NFTBOT), where two of them are password protected (45.rar and Upload.Openbot.rar).

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: Compressed files within the same repository.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: Within these compressed files, we found five distinct RedLine Stealer loaders.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: Different RedLine Stealer loaders in the same repository.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: All five loaders we analyzed are slightly different, but they all unpack and inject RedLine Stealer in a similar way, as we described earlier in this analysis. The oldest sample we found was likely compiled on March 11, 2022 and the newest one on April 7, 2022.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: Furthermore, two out of five files are digitally signed, which may bypass some antivirus engines. The first one seems to be using a signature from NordVPN S.A.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: RedLine Stealer digitally signed.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: And the second is signed for EasyAntiCheat Oy.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: RedLine Stealer digitally signed.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: Also, one of the loaders is injecting the payload into AppLaunch.exe instead of RegSvcs.exe.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: RedLine Stealer being injected into AppLaunch process.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
chapter_title: More Files From the Same Campaign
text: We found four distinct RedLine Stealer payloads from these five loaders, which are all sharing the same C2 address.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Although RedLine Stealer is a low-cost malware, it offers many capabilities that could cause serious damage to its victims, such as the loss of sensitive data. RedLine Stealer was already known for abusing YouTube videos to spread through fake themes, however, we saw in this campaign that the attacker is also abusing GitHub in the attack flow, to host the payloads.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Netskope Threat Labs is actively monitoring this campaign and has ensured coverage for all known threat indicators and payloads.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: Netskope Threat ProtectionNetskope Advanced Threat Protection provides proactive coverage against this threat.Win32.Trojan.RedLineStealer Gen.Malware.Detect.By.StHeur indicates a sample that was detected using static analysis Gen.Malware.Detect.By.Sandbox indicates a sample that was detected by our cloud sandbox

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
text: All the IOCs related to this campaign and the Yara rules can be found in our GitHub repository.

report_title: RedLine Stealer Campaign Using Binance Mystery Box Videos to Spread GitHub-Hosted Payload
